articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: The strikes came after days of bombing by Israel of Beirut suburbs considered strongholds for Hezbollah.
articles.title: Heavy strikes shake Beirut as Israel expands Lebanon campaign

articles.author: Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: Israelis on Monday marked the first anniversary of the devastating Hamas attack that triggered a war which has sparked protest worldwide and risks igniting a far wider conflict in the Middle East.
articles.title: Israel marks Oct. 7 anniversary under shadow of escalating war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In the past year in the Gaza Strip, Israel has bombed more than 40,000 targets, found 4,700 tunnel shafts and destroyed 1,000 rocket launcher sites, the military said on Monday's one-year anniversary of the Hamas-led militant attacks that triggered Israel's assault on the enclave.
articles.title: In one year of war, Israel strikes 40,000 Hamas targets in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of pro-Palestinian demonstrators protested in cities around the world on Sunday on the eve of the first anniversary of the deadly Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel that triggered the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Thousands stage pro-Palestinian protests worldwide, on eve of Oct 7 attack that triggered Gaza war

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Widespread anger among Arab Americans and Muslims over U.S. support for Israel's wars in Gaza and Lebanon could cost Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee, the election, Green Party candidate Jill Stein told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.title: Jill Stein sees 'no lesser evil' between Harris, Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The mayor of the capital of Mexico's violence-plagued state of Guerrero was killed on Sunday less than a week after he took office, the state's governor confirmed.
articles.title: Mexican mayor assassinated days after taking office

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Dutch Defence Minister Ruben Brekelmans said on a surprise visit to Kyiv on Sunday that his country will invest 400 million euros ($440 million) in advanced drone development with Ukraine and deliver more F-16s in the coming months.
articles.title: Dutch defence minister pledges 400 mln euros for drone action plan with Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Chinese nationals were killed in an explosion near the international airport of the southern Pakistani city of Karachi on Sunday night, the Chinese embassy in Pakistan said, in what it described as a "terrorist attack".
articles.title: Chinese embassy says citizens killed in 'terrorist attack' in Pakistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tunisia's polling stations opened on Sunday for the country's presidential election, with three candidates running, including one in jail.
articles.title: Tunisia polling stations open for presidential election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "God save the Tsar!" was one of the first public birthday wishes for President Vladimir Putin who turns 72 on Monday and who has been Russia's paramount leader for nearly quarter of a century.
articles.title: 'God save the Tsar!': Putin receives first wishes for 72nd birthday
